誤解する、勘違いする
In Japanese, "誤解する" (gokai suru) and "勘違いする" (kanchigai suru) both mean "to misunderstand" or "to get the wrong idea," but there is a slight difference in nuance.
"誤解する" (gokai suru) generally refers to a misunderstanding that arises from a lack of information or a misinterpretation of information. It implies that the misunderstanding is unintentional and not necessarily the fault of the person who misunderstands.
On the other hand, "勘違いする" (kanchigai suru) often implies that the misunderstanding is due to a mistake made by the person who misunderstands. It suggests that the person made an incorrect assumption or jumped to conclusions without sufficient evidence.
So, in short, "誤解する" (gokai suru) implies a more neutral or innocent misunderstanding, while "勘違いする" (kanchigai suru) implies a mistake or error on the part of the person who misunderstands.
